title: Strictly's Kelvin Fletcher sings Ain't No Sunshine as mics are turned on
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Strictly Come Dancing’s celebs prove to be quite the singers (and sassy) with a secret look at what they’re saying through their dance routines.

The BBC have posted a new hilarious clip about what’s being said as each star takes on their routines, switching on their microphones for us to hear what we missed from Saturday’s live show.

Mike Bushell and Katya Jones fully acted out their lovers’ quarrel after a night out in their quickstep to Come On Eileen, with Mike telling Katya to hurry up as she storms across the dancefloor in a huff.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But then naturally the pair make up by the end of their performance over some chips (because who can say no to some free chips at the end of a night dancing?!)

Meanwhile, Kelvin Fletcher can add ‘secret singer’ to his ever-growing arsenal of tricks, singing Ain’t No Sunshine into Oti’s ear as they clear a rumba that was labelled ‘filth’.

And as ever, he’s really annoyingly good at it.

The group’s secret messages are now not so secret (Picture: BBC)

Janette Manrara also gave herself a Camila Cabello makeover as she performed with Will Bayley, singing Senorita to him as they performed.

Catherine Tyldesley was also getting some serious sass from Johannes Radebe with some finger waves and ‘heys’ to keep her in the Single Ladies spirit as they danced around a nail salon.

Last week’s episode of Strictly was definitely a controversial one, with the shock elimination of Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell after a live show of scores dubbed bizarre by viewers.

More: Strictly Come Dancing Strictly warns celebs to keep their Nans at bay until Blackpool Strictly's Alex Scott drops partner Neil Jones on his head after 13-hour rehearsal Saffron Barker quits Strictly Come Dancing rehearsals after 'crippling back pain'

They landed in the dance-off against Aljaz Skorjanec and Viscountess Emma Weymouth, who managed to save themselves with a Jive to Kids in America.

Now the celebs know that no one is safe unless they secure those all important public votes, the competition has just been ramped up to 11.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing revealed what was being said during last week's routines as the celebs gave it their all on the dance floor.
